page.title: 17TRAFFIC AND TRANSPORT (1)
page.content: D BLOCK 04280438 The southern boundary of our D block is approximately 5 km north of Leeds city centre.The main arterial roads running north to south converge with the A61 near St. Andrew's School and at the Alwoodley roundabout.We conducted a traffic survey near the school and our findings are reported in the traffic survey p.18 Running east to west across our D block is the Leeds outer Ring Road the A6120(T) which encircles the city. TRAFFIC ON THE MOORTOWN RING ROAD. We counted traffic at different times and found that the busiest periods were in the 'rush hours',8.30-9.00 and 17.00-17.30 (25.6.85)Between 11.00 and 11.30 it was less busy. CARS LORRIES BUSES CYCLES EAST: 1179 38 16 14 WEST: 1528 37 17 13
